content: The following lists events that happened during **(/wiki/1957) in [Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore)**. ## Incumbents - [Governor](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore): - until 9 December: Sir [Robert Brown Black](/wiki/Robert_Brown_Black) - starting 9 December: Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) - [Chief Minister](/wiki/Chief_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) - [Chief Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): - until 9 December: Sir [William Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) ## Events ### February - 7 February – A series of conference starts to prepare for the upcoming Merdeka Talks. ### March - 5 March – [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) lays out his proposals for the upcoming Merdeka Talks. - 11 March – The second Merdeka Talks took place. - 21 March – The Singapore Industrial Promotion Board was formed to develop various industries in colonial Singapore. ### April - 11 April – The British Government agrees to allow Singapore its self governance. - 27 April – The first [Pontianak](/wiki/Pontianak_(film)) film was released, establishing the horror genre in the local film industry. ### June - 29 June – [By-elections](/wiki/1957_Singaporean_by-elections) in [Tanjong Pagar](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_Constituency) and [Cairnhill](/wiki/Cairnhill_Single_Member_Constituency) constituencies were held, with [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) winning his seat and Soh Ghee Soon from the [Liberal Socialist Party](/wiki/Liberal_Socialist_Party_(Singapore)) winning the other. ### July - 1 July – The [Berita Harian](/wiki/Berita_Harian_(Singapore)) is launched. ### August - 4 August – The 4th [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) Party Conference was held. Six left-wing members were elected to the 12-member Central Executive Committee. - 6 August – [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) and five other right-wing PAP CEC members does not recognize the results of the 4th Party Conference and refused to resume office. - 13 August – The [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) left-wing took over key post of the CEC, ending the week old crisis. - 21-22 August – Chief Minister [Lim Yew Hock](/wiki/Lim_Yew_Hock) launched a series of anti-communist mass arrests under the [Preservation of Public Security Ordinance](/wiki/Internal_Security_Act_(Singapore)) known as Operation Apple. About 35 people were detained including the five of the newly elected CEC members and 13 branch officials of the [PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party). ### October - 20 October – A new Central Executive Committee of the PAP is formed with [Toh Chin Chye](/wiki/Toh_Chin_Chye) as Chairman and [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) as Secretary-General. ### November - 1 November – The Citizenship Ordinance in 1957 commenced with registration of Singapore citizenship. - 3 November – The [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)) is formed by [David Marshall](/wiki/David_Marshall_(Singaporean_politician)) with the inauguration held at the [Hokkien Association](/wiki/Singapore_Hokkien_Huay_Kuan) Hall at [Telok Ayer Street](/wiki/Telok_Ayer_Street). ### December - 21 December – The [City Council elections](/wiki/1957_Singapore_City_Council_election) was held, with the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) winning a majority of the seats. - 24 December – [Ong Eng Guan](/wiki/Ong_Eng_Guan) is sworn in as the first [Mayor of Singapore](/wiki/Mayor_of_Singapore). ## Births - 14 January – [V. K. Rajah](/wiki/V._K._Rajah), 8th [Attorney-General of Singapore](/wiki/Attorney-General_of_Singapore). - 25 February – [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam), 9th [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). - 13 April – [Ellen Lee](/wiki/Ellen_Lee), former PAP Member of Parliament for [Sembawang GRC](/wiki/Sembawang_Group_Representation_Constituency). - 2 July – [Yam Ah Mee](/wiki/Yam_Ah_Mee), former brigadier-general and civil servant. - 1 August – [Davinder Singh](/wiki/Davinder_Singh_(lawyer)), lawyer. - 24 September – [Lee Hsien Yang](/wiki/Lee_Hsien_Yang), business executive. - 3 October – [Jacintha Abisheganaden](/wiki/Jacintha_Abisheganaden), singer, actress and theater practitioner. - 15 December – [Andrew Phang](/wiki/Andrew_Phang), judge in the Supreme Court. - George Quek, founder of [BreadTalk](/wiki/BreadTalk). ## Deaths - 1 January – [Lim Boon Keng](/wiki/Lim_Boon_Keng), doctor and reformer (b. 1869). - 29 January – [Tay Koh Yat](/wiki/Tay_Koh_Yat), Chinese community leader and founder of the Tay Koh Yat Bus Company (b. 1880). - 2 April – Chew Hock Seng, eldest son of Chew Boon Lay (b. 1883). - 31 December – Ong Piah Teng, businessman and nominated legislative assemblyman of the [1st Legislative Assembly](/wiki/1st_Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore) (b. 1892). title: 1957 in Singapore
